title: LIVE Tamil Nadu trust vote: EPS, OPS supporters gear up for floor test : India, News - India Today
text:
LIVE Tamil Nadu trust vote: EPS, OPS supporters gear up for floor test The Tamil Nadu Assembly goes for the trust vote at 11 am. Here are the latest updates. IndiaToday.in | Posted by Bijin Jose A + A - E Palaniswami 
The stage is set for Tamil Nadu Chief Minister E Palaniswami to prove the majority of his government today. The Assembly goes for the trust vote at 11 am. Palaniswami, who was sworn in as Chief Minister on February 16, was given 15 days time by governor in-charge C Vidyasagar Rao to prove his majority. However, he decided to seek the vote of confidence on Saturday. It is believed that he is seeking early trust vote so that the MLAs supporting him doesn't change their mind. 
Palaniswami has claimed the support of as many as 125 out of 135 AIADMK MLAs. 
If all the 234 MLAs remain present during the time of voting, Palaniswami will need 118 votes to prove his majority. He will be in trouble if even seven of the 124 MLAs change their mind during voting. 
Meanwhile, Panneerselvam urged AIADMK MLAs to vote against the vote of confidence sought by Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami, stating they should not aid a "family rule" and supporting the motion would amount to betraying late party chief Jayalalithaa and people who voted for party. 
HERE ARE THE LIVE UPDATES: Palaniswami reaches secretariat Amma's legacy rests on abled shlders of OPS, this will be driving force to vote, not temporary confinement of brainwashing: M Pandiarajan Barricading, Heavy police deployment outside TN secretariat ahead of floor test We don't think we are in single digit. We believe 135 people should vote for us: M Pandiarajan,Former TN Minister and OPS supporter AIADMK Party MLAs leaving Kuvathur's Golden Bay resort say "we will win, heading to the assembly" We have to safeguard our party, symbol and the Government. Will work with Chinamma: AIADMK MLA leaves Kuvathur resort Whip issued for all party MLAs, we will vote accordingly: Thoppu N D Venkatachalam, AIADMK MLA AIADMK party MLAs leaving Kuvathur's Golden Bay resort, will attend special session of the Tamil Nadu assembly floor test School students gather outside Golden Bay resort in Kuvathur in support of Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami who faces floor test today
